intro: Stachytarpheta trispicata, commonly known as the purpletop verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and opposite leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of two-lipped, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, or white, which bloom in late summer and early fall. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its attractive appearance and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies add both aesthetic and ecological value to the landscape.
